Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: Presents!

Speaker: father christmas
Dialogue: Lucy, Eve's Daughter. These are for you. The juice of the fire flower. If you, or one of your friends are wounded, one drop of this cordial will restore them. And though I do not expect you to use it, this.

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: Well, I think I could be brave enough.

Speaker: father christmas
Dialogue: I'm sure you could. But battles are ugly affairs. Eve's Daughter, Susan. Trust in this bow, for it does not easily miss.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: What happened to, 'battles are ugly affairs?'

Speaker: father christmas
Dialogue: And, though you don't seem to have trouble making yourself heard, this. When you put this horn to your lips and blow it, wherever you are, help will come.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: father christmas
Dialogue: And, Peter. These are tools, not toys. The time to use them may be soon at hand.

Speaker: father christmas
Dialogue: Bare them well! I best be off, winter is almost over and things do pile up when you've been gone a thousand years. Long live Aslan!

Speaker: the children
Dialogue: Bye... Merry Christmas!

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: Told you he was real!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Did you hear what he said... winter is almost over. You no what that means... no more ice!

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Wait, maybe we should think about this.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: We don't have time.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: I was just trying to be realistic

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: No, you're trying to be smart...as usual!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Maybe you should.

Speaker: mr beaver
Dialogue: Well you never know what meal is gonna be your last, especially with your cooking.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: if mum knew what we were doing...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Mum's not here!!!

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: Oh no!

Speaker: maugrim
Dialogue: Put that down boy, someone might get hurt.

Speaker: maugrim
Dialogue: Leave now while you can, and you're brother leaves with you.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Stop Peter, maybe we should listen to him!

Speaker: maugrim
Dialogue: Smart girl.  MR. BEAVER Don't listen to him. Kill him. Kill him now!

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Look, just because some man in a red suit hands you a sword doesn't make you a hero! So just drop it!

Speaker: beaver
Dialogue: No Peter! Narnia need ya!

Speaker: maugrim
Dialogue: What's it gonna be Son of Adam? We're not going to wait for ever. And neither is the river.

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: PETER!!!!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Hold onto me!

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: What have you done?!

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: Has anyone seen my coat?

Speaker: dwarf
Dialogue: It's so warm here!  I think I'll go check the sleigh.

Speaker: wolf
Dialogue: We found the traitor  He was gathering troops near the sharwood forest.

Speaker: white witch
Dialogue: Nice of you to drop by. I understand you were so helpful to my wolves last night.

Speaker: fox
Dialogue: Forgive me your majesty

Speaker: white witch
Dialogue: Don't waste my time with flattery.

Speaker: fox
Dialogue: Not to seem rude, but I wasn't actually talking to you

Speaker: edmund
Dialogue: Wait! The Beavers said something about the Stone Table and an army.

Speaker: white witch
Dialogue: Thank you Edmund. It is good for this creature to see some honesty before he dies..

Speaker: edmund
Dialogue: NO!

Speaker: white witch
Dialogue: Think who's side you are on. MINE... It's a war he shall get.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Why are they all staring at us?

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: Maybe they think you look funny.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: We have come to see Aslan.

Speaker: aslan
Dialogue: Welcome Peter Adam's son, Welcome Susan and Lucy daughters-of-Eve. Welcome Beavers. You have my thanks, but where is the fourth.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: That's why we are here.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: We had a little trouble along the way.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: He's been captured by the White Witch

Speaker: crowd
Dialogue: Captured!

Speaker: oreius
Dialogue: Then he has betrayed us all

Speaker: aslan
Dialogue: Peace Oreius.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: It is my fault really. I was too hard on him.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: We all were.

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: Sir, he's our brother.

Speaker: aslan
Dialogue: I know dear and that makes the betrayal all the worse. It may be harder than you think

Speaker: aslan
Dialogue: That is Cair Paravel of the four thrones one of which you must sit as High King.

Speaker: aslan
Dialogue: You doubt the prophecy

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: No, that's just it...you're not who I think I am

Speaker: aslan
Dialogue: Peter Pevensie formerly of Finnchley. Beaver also said you wanted to turn him into a hat.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: I don't think I will be able.

Speaker: aslan
Dialogue: You were able to get your family here.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Not all of them.

Speaker: aslan
Dialogue: I will do what I can for Edmund. I too want my family safe.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Mother hasn't had a dress like this since before the war

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: Maybe we had bring back a whole trunk load when we go home.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: If we go home...Sorry I guess I am like that. Remember when we use to have fun?

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: Yes, before you go boring.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Oh really

Speaker: wolf
Dialogue: Now, We're very tired. We'd prefer to kill you quickly.

Speaker: cut to
Dialogue: Peter and Aslan

Speaker: cut to
Dialogue: Susan and Lucy  Susan and Lucy are in a tree and wolf trying to get them. Peter come back through the river

Speaker: aslan
Dialogue: Follow him! He'll lead you to Edmund. Peter, clean your sword.

Speaker: aslan
Dialogue: Rise, Sir Peter Wolfsbane--Knight of Narnia.

Speaker: general otmin
Dialogue: The Minotaurs on the left, send in the dwarfs first.

Speaker: dwarf
Dialogue: You're not going to kill him?

Speaker: white witch
Dialogue: Not yet! We have work to do

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: EDMUND!  Peter stops her. Aslan motions Edmund down and they go to the group of his siblings

Speaker: aslan
Dialogue: What's done is done. There is no reason to bring up the past with your brother.

Speaker: edmund
Dialogue: Hello...

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: Oh, Edmund

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: How are you feeling?

Speaker: edmund
Dialogue: I'm feeling kinda tired

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Get some rest...and Edmund try not to wander off again.

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: Narnia isn't going to run out of toast Edmund

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: then you better pack some for the journey

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: So were going home?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: You are, I promised I'd keep you three safe but there's no reason I can't stay and help.

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: but they need us...All four of us

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Lucy it's too dangerous. You almost drowned, Edmund was almost killed!

Speaker: edmund
Dialogue: Which is why we have to stay.

Speaker: edmund
Dialogue: I've seen what the White Witch can do and I've helped her do it, and we can't leave these people behind to suffer for it.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Well I guess that's it then. *gets up*

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Where are you going?

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: To get in some practice.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Come on Ed, sword hand up like Oreius showed us.

Speaker: edmund
Dialogue: Whoa horsey!

Speaker: horse
Dialogue: My name is Philip.

Speaker: edmund
Dialogue: Oh, sorry

Speaker: dwarf
Dialogue: Jadis.. Jadis!!!  Jadis arrives at the camp, Cyclops carry her bed-thingy...She hops down, and walks towards Aslan

Speaker: jadis
Dialogue: You have a traitor in your midst, Aslan.

Speaker: aslan
Dialogue: His offence was not against you.

Speaker: white witch
Dialogue: Have you forgotten the Deep Magic?

Speaker: aslan
Dialogue: Do not cite the Deep Magic to me, Witch. I was there when it was made.

Speaker: white witch
Dialogue: Then you will know that the boy belongs to me.  will die on the Stone Table.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Come and take it then.

Speaker: white witch
Dialogue: You think that a simple threat will deny me my right, little king? Aslan knows that if I do not have blood as the law demands, all of Narnia will be overturned, and perish, in fire and water.

Speaker: aslan
Dialogue: Enough, I shall talk with you alone.

Speaker: aslan
Dialogue: The Witch has denounced her claim on Edmund

Speaker: white witch
Dialogue: How will I know your promise will be kept?

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: Susan!  Susan see's the shadow, the two leave their tent. Aslan is leaving the camp...they follow him. and follow him...and follow him. Until-

Speaker: aslan
Dialogue: Aren't you suppose to be in bed?

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: We couldn't sleep

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Please, Aslan. Couldn't we come with you?

Speaker: aslan
Dialogue: I would be glad of the company tonight.

Speaker: aslan
Dialogue: It is time. From now on, I must go on alone. Thank you Susan. Thank you Lucy. And farewell.

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: Why doesn't he fight back?

Speaker: white witch
Dialogue: Bind him. Wait. First let him be shaved.

Speaker: white witch
Dialogue: Tonight, the Deep magic will be appeased, but tomorrow, we will take Narnia, Forever!

Speaker: white witch
Dialogue: You know, Aslan, I'm a little disappointed in you. Did you really think that by giving your life you would save the Human boy? Ha. You are giving up your life, and saving no one. So much for love.

Speaker: white witch
Dialogue: In that knowledge... Despair... and DIE!!!!!!

Speaker: white witch
Dialogue: The great cat is DEAD!!

Speaker: white witch
Dialogue: General, gather your army and prepare for battle. However short it may be.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: It's too late. He's gone. I'm sure he knew what he was doing.

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: We can't just leave him here.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Lucy there's not time. We have to tell the others.

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: The Trees

Speaker: dryad
Dialogue: Fear not my princes. I come with tidings of grave news..

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: It is true, he's gone

Speaker: edmund
Dialogue: Then you'll have to lead us. There's a whole army out there waiting to follow you.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: I can't

Speaker: edmund
Dialogue: Aslan believed you could. And so do I.

Speaker: oreius
Dialogue: what are your orders?  Peter looks at map... you see the battle field

Speaker: gryphon
Dialogue: They come, you highness, in numbers and weapons far greater then our own.

Speaker: oreius
Dialogue: Numbers do not win a battle

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: No, but I bet they help

Speaker: white witch
Dialogue: I take no interest in prisoners. Kill them all

Speaker: otman
Dialogue: Look to the sky

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Are you with me?

Speaker: orieus
Dialogue: To the death!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: FOR NARNIA, AND FOR ASLAN!!!!

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: We should go.

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: I'm so cold.

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: Susan!

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: What have they done?

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: We saw the Witch, the knife.

Speaker: aslan
Dialogue: If the Witch knew the true meaning of sacrifice, she might have interpreted the Deep Magic a little differently. For she would know that if a willing victim who had committed no treachery died in a traitors stead, the Stone Table would crack and death itself would begin to unwind.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: We sent the word that you were dead. Peter and Edmund would have gone to war.

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: We have to help them.

Speaker: aslan
Dialogue: We will, but not alone. Now, climb on my back. We have a long ways to go and little time to get there. And you might want to cover your ears. ROAR!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Fall back! Draw them to the rocks!

Speaker: beaver
Dialogue: That's the signal! Get ready!

Speaker: edmund
Dialogue: FIRE!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Stop!

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: Susan this is...

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: MR TUMNUS!!!!

Speaker: aslan
Dialogue: Come, lets search the castle - others may still be trapped inside and Peter will need all the help he can get.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Ed! There are too many of them! Go! Get out of here! Get the girls, and get them home!

Speaker: beaver
Dialogue: Come on, you heard him!  Ed starts to leave, then sees the Witch. And starts to go back

Speaker: beaver
Dialogue: Peter said to go!

Speaker: edmund
Dialogue: Peter's not King yet!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Edmund!!

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: Impossible!

Speaker: aslan
Dialogue: It is finished.

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Where's Edmund?

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Edmund!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: When are you ever going to do are you're told?

Speaker: aslan
Dialogue: Bring forth the crowns!

Speaker: aslan
Dialogue: And to the clear northern skies, King Peter the Magnificent. Once a king or Queen of Narnia, always a king or queen.

Speaker: everyone
Dialogue: Long live King Peter! Long live Queen Susan! Long live King Edmund! And long live Queen Lucy!

Speaker: tumnus
Dialogue: We'll see him again.

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: When?

Speaker: tumnus
Dialogue: In time...you mustn't press him, He isn't a tame lion...

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: No, but he's good...

Speaker: tumnus
Dialogue: Here  I think you need this more than I do.

Speaker: edmund
Dialogue: You alright there Philip?

Speaker: philip
Dialogue: Not as young as I used to be?

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Come on Ed.

Speaker: edmund
Dialogue: Just catching my breath

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: What did he say, Susan?

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: You girls stay at the castle, I'll go get the stag myself.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: What is this?

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: It seems like a dream...

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: Or a dream of a dream...Spare Oom

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Not again

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: Come on

Speaker: edmund
Dialogue: She always running off

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: These aren't branches...

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: There coats

Speaker: all
Dialogue: Stop pushing...ah....

Speaker: professor
Dialogue: There you are. Now what were children doing the wardrobe?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: You wouldn't believe us if we told you

Speaker: professor
Dialogue: Try me

Speaker: professor
Dialogue: I don't think you'll get back in that way...you see I've already tried.

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: Will we ever go back?

Speaker: professor
Dialogue: I expect so, probably when you least expect it. What's to say Keep your eyes open
